title: Test
yAxis: Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points.
Overall Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.

Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars is slightly increasing from 2007 to 2008, roughly constant from 2008 to 2010, slightly decreasing from 2010 to 2011, roughly constant from 2011 to 2015, slightly increasing from 2015 to 2016, and lastly slightly decreasing from 2016 to 2018.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2017 and 2018.
Max Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 89.95 was recorded at Year 2017
Min Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 56.1 was recorded at Year 2007
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 3 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2012 to 2018.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2007 to 2010.
But, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2010 to 2012.
